pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, February 8, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Monday, February 8, 2016:

Ottawa

10:30 a.m. The Prime Minister, along with the Minister of Foreign Affairs, the Honourable St√©phane Dion, the Minister of National Defence, the Honourable Harjit S. Sajjan, and the Minister of International Development and La Francophonie, the Honourable Marie-Claude Bibeau, will make an important announcement.

National Press Theatre
150 Wellington Street
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • A technical briefing will follow the announcement by the Prime Minister with officials from National Defence and Global Affairs Canada.
  • Journalists who are not members of the National Press Gallery will require accreditation from the gallery in advance. For more information, contact Collin Lafrance at collin.lafrance@parl.gc.ca.
  • Out-of-town journalists can also dial in to listen to the news conference, as well as the technical briefing. Please note these will be set up as listen-only mode lines. International callers must dial the local phone number for proper access.

Participant dial-in numbers
Local: 613-960-7527
Toll-free from Canada and U.S.: 877-413-4815
Pass code: 1972076

5:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the 2016 Assistant Deputy Minister Forum.

Closed to media.

PMO Media Relations: 613-957-5555
